intro: Diplycosia tetramera, commonly known as the four-leafed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to certain regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of eucalyptus and other host trees. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are often clustered in groups of four, giving it its common name. It produces small white or yellowish flowers and relies on insects for pollination. Its ecological role includes providing food for various native birds and insects.
